content: page 1 of 1 use this simple pattern to knit a beautiful dishcloth that will add a touch of handcrafted beauty to your daily life an easy-to-memorize combination of knit and purl stitches makes this pattern interesting enough to keep you knitting and simple enough for a beginner to master quickly this pattern is part of the tutorial how to incorporate a stitch pattern into your own knitted creation which can be found here at kierstenj com the name comes from how the repeated stitch pattern on the chart resembles a checkerboard materials dishcloth cotton ~100 yards knitting needles scissors and a tapestry needle i used us size 7 knitting needles and one ball of dishcloth cotton for each dishcloth cast on 46 stitches knit 8 row 4 garter ridges charted section row 1 knit 4 purl 2 knit 2 x 9 purl 2 knit 4 row 2 knit 4 knit 2 purl 2 x 9 knit 2 knit 4 row 3 knit 4 knit 2 purl 2 x 9 knit 2 knit 4 row 4 knit 4 purl 2 knit 2 x 9 purl 2 knit 4 knit 8 row 4 garter ridges bind off break off yarn weave in ends use or give in good health and happiness happy knitting ~ kiersten j © 2024 kiersten harrod all rights reserved go to www kierstenj com for more resources to help you be a better knitter
